description: Daffodil Sagana  Daffodils are a popular choice across UK gardens for many reasons, such as being one of the most cost-effective, pest-free perennial plants there are, and they make beautiful additions to spring bulb arrangements! Daffodils look great when planted with perennials, annuals and other flowering shrubs too, but the Sagana grows with a unique difference to the standard daffodil. It might have the looks of more common varieties like 'Pheasants Eye', but this flower grows with much stronger and larger blooms that stand upright and really form a show-stopping display in garden borders and patio pots!  As white as can be petals smother the button like trumpet of vibrant yellow, with a fiery orange rim. A musky fragrance diffuses from the blooms which work perfectly for cut flower arrangements so this bulb really can be enjoyed indoors and out! Sagana is a strong, long-lived bulb that will thrive in sunny, well-drained places and will develop these magnificent flowers in multiples with minimal maintenance. Height: 40cm (16). description: Spring Flowering Bulb Bonanza Collection  Bring your garden to life with this fantastic collection of spring-flowering bulbs. We‚Äôve put together a cheerful mix of much-loved varieties that will bring colour from February through to May wherever it grows. Ideal for planting in dense groups through the front of borders, or placing around the rockery. Why not layer them up in patio pots for a long-lasting succession of colour? Wherever you plant them, these low-maintenance and easy to grow bulbs will return year after year, to welcome the spring to your garden.  Spring Flowering Bulb Bonanza Collection includes:    15 bulbs x Allium sphaerocephalon¬†- An understated allium with unusual oval-shaped, purple-green flower heads perched atop tall, slender stems. description: Drifts of graceful nodding snowdrops signal winters end with an understated elegance. description: Oxalis Censation Double Pink Wonder  This attractive Oxalis, also known as Shamrock, boasts double, blush white flowers that contrast with their red picotee edges. This variety is a low growing bulb, producing a spreading clump of triangular, clover-like foliage. Although perennial, this magnificent plant is only half-hardy.  In particularly mild and sheltered areas, they can be grown outdoors in rock gardens or alpine troughs, but should be protected from frost at all times. In most parts of the UK, they are best grown in containers and moved to a frost-free position in early autumn. Height and spread: 15cm (6‚Äù).

description: This is a variety for the 21st century which is a far cry from the golden daffodils of years gone by. Narcissus ?Hungarian Rhapsody? boasts large, colour changing blooms, and it has a strong growth habit. Its delicate white petals surrounds the orange-pink, split corona, which gradually changes to golden yellow as it matures. The magnificent blooms are carried on sturdy stems that make excellent cut flowers. Plant this pretty daffodil in bold drifts in cottage garden borders, or in patio containers for a striking spring display. Height: 45cm (18). Spread: 15cm (6).

category_path: Garden > Plants & Plant Care > Garden Plants & Bushes
description: Daffodil Sagana  Daffodils are a popular choice across UK gardens for many reasons, such as being one of the most cost-effective, pest-free perennial plants there are, and they make beautiful additions to spring bulb arrangements! Daffodils look great when planted with perennials, annuals and other flowering shrubs too, but the Sagana grows with a unique difference to the standard daffodil. It might have the looks of more common varieties like 'Pheasants Eye', but this flower grows with much stronger and larger blooms that stand upright and really form a show-stopping display in garden borders and patio pots!  As white as can be petals smother the button like trumpet of vibrant yellow, with a fiery orange rim. A musky fragrance diffuses from the blooms which work perfectly for cut flower arrangements so this bulb really can be enjoyed indoors and out! Sagana is a strong, long-lived bulb that will thrive in sunny, well-drained places and will develop these magnificent flowers in multiples with minimal maintenance. Height: 40cm (16). Spread: 30cm (12).

category_path: Garden > Plants & Plant Care > Garden Plants & Bushes
description: Saffron Crocus Bulbs  Grow the most expensive spice in the world!  The Saffron Crocus Bulb is a beautiful autumn blooming Crocus (Crocus sativus). Saffron is the quintessential season for paella and other delicious Mediterranean dishes. Rich in taste, aroma and history, Saffron is the whole package in your garden.  The Saffron flower is a Crocus variety that commands attention and throughout history that is exactly what it has done! The spice was very much sought after by the Ancient Greeks for its aroma, colour and health benefits. As early as 400 BC, Hippocrates was writing about how amazing Saffron was and even wrote about it being a ‚Äòcure‚Äô for coughs, colds, stomach aches, insomnia and heart problems!  Famous for the rich yellow coloured powder that Saffron produces, it has been used as dye for clothing for centuries. A single gram of Saffron can dye roughly 40 litres of water, creating a distinctive yellow hue that has been used by buddhist monks for many years. In fact this is still the way they dye their K???ya‚Äôs.  The Flower  The Saffron Crocus produces purple flowers, delicately decorated with fine brush strokes of purple throughout the petals. The 3 pronged stigma protrudes from the centre with a striking crimson colour to contrast beautifully with the rest of the plant, making them really stand out amongst other flowers. The crimson stigmas are what is needed to create the most expensive spice in the world. However, you don‚Äôt have to harvest these stigmas. Keep them on the flower to enjoy the contrasting colour and the striking scent they produce.

All bulbs are sourced from cultivated stocks.)  Tulips are a must for every spring garden, creating colourful displays in beds, borders, containers and rockeries. These classic beauties are, of course, the perfect companions to spring bedding plants, and they make superb cut flowers too. They are the embodiment of a British spring garden, but did you know that they have their humble origins in the mountains of Kazakhstan? And did you know that in the early 17th century, when 'tulip mania' hit Holland, prices of the recently introduced bulbs soared, some single bulbs selling for more than 10 times the annual income of a skilled craftsman! Today there are literally thousands of varieties available, in a stunning array of colours and forms.

category_path: Garden > Plants & Plant Care > Garden Plants & Bushes
description: Tulip Bulbs - Rembrandt Mix  Create stunning masterpieces in your garden with this beautiful Tulip mix.  The Tulip Bulbs - Rembrandt Mix is a stunning collection of tulips in a profusion of colours. The beautiful flowers produced by these bulbs, create stunning flower displays all through flower beds and flower borders. Creating more than just a pretty picture, these tulips are truly delightful grown in decorative patio containers, making more than just a masterpiece.  Although the Tulip Bulbs - Rembrandt Mix are named after famous and renowned artist Rembrandt, he very rarely painted tulips or any flowers for that matter. These Tulips are named because they are decorated by magnificent petals with a painterly strokes of red or yellow as if they had been pulled straight from a painting!  Rembrandt famously immortalised these Tulips in his painting of his wife called ‚ÄòFlora‚Äô in which she wears a wreath of flowers. The largest flower of them all is the gorgeous Rembrandt Tulip. Rembrandt lived and worked in Holland around the time that tulips first became all the rage there, particularly the ones with streaks and stripes of colour. These types of tulips were bought for huge sums of money during the so-called ‚ÄòTulipmania‚Äô period (1593‚Äì1637), making the Tulips a perfect addition to his painting.  The Tulip Bulbs - Rembrandt Mix includes 5 striking bicoloured Tulips that flower from March until May. Growing to a height of 45cm, these hardy perennials are absolutely perfect for creating beautiful masterpieces in your garden this season.

description: Nerine Bowdenii Pink  Brighten up autumn borders!  With dramatic deep green recurved leaves and a beautiful shade of magenta-pink funnel-shaped flowers, Nerine Bowdenii 'Pink' is guaranteed to brighten up any autumn border when other blooms are fading away. These impressive, autumn-flowering Guernsey lilies sit on tall, slender but sturdy stems which make stunning cut flowers at a time when blooms are scarce. The hardiest of the species, Nerine bowdenii can be grown in the greenhouse, or outdoors in pots or well-drained borders and rockeries. This easy to grow RHS AGM species is best planted in tight clumps for a dramatic late-season display.
